  '<!-- PageBreak -->\n'
  '\n'
  '6/24/25, 5:21 PM\n'
  '\n'
  'slportal.uiic.in/Configurator/HTMLReportSource/rei3ckas5sidov552op4vm45UniGroupHealthInsurancePolicy_2025061921666 '
  '..\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 14.Renewal Terms\n'
  '\n'
  'Alterations like increase/ decrease in Sum Insured or change in optional '
  'covers can be requested at the time of Renewal of the Policy.\n'
  'We reserve Our right to carry out assessment of the group and provide the '
  'Renewal quote in respect of the revised Policy.\n'
  'We may in Our sole discretion, revise the premiums payable under the Policy '
  'or the terms of the cover, provided that all such changes\n'
  'are in accordance with the IRDAI rules and regulations as applicable from '
  'time to time.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 15.Our Right of Termination\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### A. Termination of Policy:\n'
  '\n'
  'Prior to the expiry of the Policy as shown in the Policy Schedule/ '
  'Certificate of Insurance, cover will end immediately for all Insured\n'
  'Persons, if:\n'
  '\n'
  'i. there is misrepresentation, fraud, non-disclosure of material fact by '
  'You / Insured Person without any refund of premium, by giving\n'
  "15 days' notice in writing by Registered Post Acknowledgment Due / recorded "
  'delivery to Your last known address.\n'
  '\n'
  'ii. there is non-cooperation by You/ Insured person, with refund of premium '
  'on pro rata basis for all lives which have not registered a\n'
  "claim with Us, after deducting Our expenses, by giving 15 days' notice in "
  'writing by Registered Post Acknowledgment Due / recorded\n'
  'delivery to Your last known address.\n'
  '\n'
  'iii. the Policyholder does not pay the premiums owed under the Policy '
  'within the Grace Period.\n'
  '\n'
  'Upon termination, cover and services under the Policy shall end '
  'immediately. Treatment and costs incurred after the date of termination\n'
  'shall not be paid. If Treatment has been authorized or an approval for '
  'Cashless facility has been issued, we will not be held responsible\n'
  'for any Treatment costs if the Policy ends. However, we will be liable to '
  'pay in respect of all claims where the Treatment/admission has\n'
  'commenced before the date of termination of such Policy.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  "### B.Termination for Insured Person's cover\n"
  '\n'
  'Cover will end for a Member or dependent:\n'
  '\n'
  'i. If the Policyholder stops paying premiums for the Insured Person(s) and '
  'their Dependents (if any);\n'
  '\n'
  'ii. When this Policy terminates at the expiry of the period shown in the '
  'Policy Schedule/ Certificate of Insurance.\n'
  '\n'
  'iii. If he or she dies;\n'
  '\n'
  'iv. When a dependent insured person ceases to be a Dependent; unless '
  'otherwise agreed specifically for continuation till end of policy\n'
  'period;\n'
  '\n'
  'v. If the Insured Person ceases to be a member of the group.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 16.Limitation of Liability\n'
  '\n'
  'If a claim is rejected or partially settled and is not the subject of any '
  'pending suit or other proceeding, as the case may be, within\n'
  'twelve months from the date of such rejection or settlement, the claim '
  'shall be deemed to have been abandoned and Our liability shall\n'
  'be extinguished and shall not be recoverable thereafter.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 17.Operation of Policy & Certificate of Insurance\n'
  '\n'
  'The Policy shall be issued for the duration as specified in the Policy '
  'Schedule/ Certificate of Insurance. The Policy takes effect on the\n'
  'Inception Date stated in the Policy Schedule and/or the Certificate of '
  'Insurance and ends on the date of expiry of the Policy. For specific\n'
  'groups, upon request, all additions thereto by way of Certificate/s of '
  'Insurance shall be valid up to the Policy Period commencing from\n'
  'the actual date of addition to the Policy, it being agreed and understood '
  'that We shall continue to extend the benefit of coverage of\n'
  'insurance to the Insured Person(s) in the same manner on Renewal of the '
  'Policy or until expiry of the Certificate of Insurance,\n'
  'whichever is later.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 18.Electronic Transactions\n'
  '\n'
  'The Policyholder/ Insured Person agrees to comply with all the terms and '
  'conditions as We shall prescribe from time to time, and\n'
  'confirms that all transactions effected facilities for conducting remote '
  'transactions such as the internet, World Wide Web, electronic\n'
  'data interchange, call centers, tele-service operations (whether voice, '
  'video, data or combination thereof) or by means of electronic,\n'
  'computer, automated machines network or through other means of '
  'telecommunication, in respect of this Policy, or Our other services,\n'
  'shall constitute legally binding when done in compliance with Our terms for '
  'such facilities.\n'
  '\n'
  'Sales through such electronic transactions shall ensure that all conditions '
  'of Section 41 of the Insurance Act, 1938 prescribed for the\n'
  'proposal form and all necessary disclosures on terms and conditions and '
  'exclusions are made known to the Policyholder/ Insured\n'
  'Person. A voice recording in case of tele-sales or other evidence for sales '
  'through the World Wide Web shall be maintained and such\n'
  'consent will be subsequently validated / confirmed by the Policyholder/ '
  'Insured Person.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 19.Communications & Notices\n'
  '\n'
  'a) Any notice, direction or instruction or any other communication related '
  'to the Policy should be made in writing.\n'
  '\n'
  'b) Such communication shall be sent to the address of the Company or '
  'through any other electronic modes at contact address as\n'
  'specified in the Policy Schedule.\n'
  '\n'
  'c) No insurance agents, brokers, other person or entity is authorized to '
  'receive any notice on behalf of Us unless explicitly stated in\n'
  'writing by Us.\n'
  '\n'
  'd) The Company shall communicate to The Policyholder/ Insured Person in '
  'writing, at the address as specified in the Policy Schedule/\n'
  'Certificate of Insurance or through any other electronic mode at the '
  'contact address as specified in the policy schedule\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 20. Territorial Jurisdiction\n'
  '\n'
  'All disputes or differences under or in relation to the interpretation of '
  'the terms, conditions, validity, construct, limitations and/or\n'
  'exclusions contained in the policy shall be determined by the Indian court '
  'and according to Indian law.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### VI.CLAIM PROCEDURE\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### d.A.Claim Process for Base Covers\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 1.Claims Administration & Process\n'
  '\n'
  '1\\. Claims Administration & Process\n'
  '\n'
  'It shall be the condition precedent to admission of Our liability under '
  'this Policy that the terms and conditions of making the payment of\n'
  'premium in full and on time, insofar as they relate to anything to be done '
  'or complied with by You or any Insured Person, are fulfilled\n'
  'including complying with the following in relation to claims:\n'
  '\n'
  '1\\. On the occurrence or discovery of any Illness or Injury that may give '
  'rise to a Claim under this Policy, the Claims Procedure set out\n'
  'below shall be followed.\n'
  '\n'
  '2\\. The treatment should be taken as per the directions, advice and '
  'guidance of the treating Medical Practitioner. Any failure to follow\n'
  'such directions, Medical advice or guidance will prejudice the claim.\n'
  '\n'
  '3\\. The Insured Person must submit to medical examination by Our Medical '
  'Practitioner or our authorized representative in case\n'
  'requested by Us and at Our cost, as often as We consider reasonable and '
  'necessary and We/Our representatives must be permitted to\n'
  'inspect the medical and Hospitalisation records pertaining to the Insured '
  "Person's treatment and to investigate the circumstances\n"
  'pertaining to the claim.\n'
  '\n'
  '4\\. We and Our representatives must be given all reasonable co-operation '
  'in investigating the claim in order to assess Our liability and\n'
  'quantum in respect of the claim.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 2. Notification of claim\n'],
 ['\n'
  '\n'
  '### 2. Reimbursement Process\n'
  '\n'
  'In addition to the documents mentioned in the Base Cover claim '
  'reimbursement process, the following additional documents will be\n'
  'required for reimbursement claim for the respective Options.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '<table>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<th>Optional Cover</th>\n'
  '<th>Additional Documents Required</th>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>Critical Illness - Benefit Cover</td>\n'
  '<td>The Insured Person may submit the following documents for reimbursement '
  'of the claim to our policy issuing office at his/her own expense ninety '
  '(90) days from the date of first diagnosis of the Illness/ date of Surgical '
  'Procedure or date of occurrence of the medical event, as the case may be '
  'Medical certificate confirming the diagnosis of Critical Illness. Discharge '
  'certificate/ card from the Hospital, if any. Investigation test reports '
  'confirming the diagnosis. First consultation letter and subsequent '
  'prescriptions. Indoor case papers, if applicable. Specific documents listed '
  'under the respective Critical Illness. Any other documents as may be '
  'required by Us. In those cases, where Critical Illness arises due to an '
  'Accident, a copy of the FIR or medico legal certificate will be required, '
  'wherever conducted.</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>Out- Patient Cover</td>\n'
  '<td>The Insured Person shall avail these benefits as defined in Policy '
  'T&amp;C if opted for. Submission of claim Invoices, treating Medical '
  "Practitioner's prescription, reports, duly signed by Insured Person as the "
  'case may be, to the TPA Head Office Assessment of claim documents We shall '
  'assess the claim documents and ascertain the admissibility of claim. '
  'Settlement &amp; Repudiation of a claim We shall settle claims, including '
  "its rejection, within 15 days of the receipt of the last 'necessary' "
  'document.</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '</table>\n'
  '\n'

  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>Dental Expenses Cover &amp; Vision Expenses Cover</td>\n'
  '<td>The Insured Person shall avail these Benefits as defined below, if '
  'opted for. Submission of claim Insured Person can send the claim form '
  "provided along with the invoices, treating Medical Practitioner's "
  'prescription, reports, duly signed by the Insured Person as the case may '
  'be, to Our branch office or head office. Assessment of claim documents We '
  'shall assess the claim documents and ascertain the admissibility of claim. '
  'Settlement &amp; Repudiation of a claim We shall settle claims, including '
  "its rejection, within 15 days of the receipt of the last 'necessary' "
  'document. In respect of Orthodontic Treatment claims for Dependent Children '
  'below 18 years, pre-authorisation is a must. For claims in respect of '
  'Orthodontic Treatment towards Dependent Children below 18 years, the '
  'Employee/ Member or Dependent must send the following information prepared '
  'by the Dentist who is to carry out the proposed Treatment to Us before '
  'Treatment starts, so that We can confirm the Benefit that will be payable: '
  '.Full description of the proposed Treatment; .X-rays and study models; .An '
  'estimate of the cost of the Treatment. Any Benefit will be payable only if '
  'We have authorised the cover before Treatment starts.</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>Refractive Error Correction Expenses Cover</td>\n'
  '<td>Prescription from Specialist Medical Practitioner specifying the '
  'refractive error and medical necessity of the Treatment.</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>Home Nursing Charges Cover</td>\n'
  '<td>Bills from registered nursing service provider.</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>Air Ambulance Cover</td>\n'
  '<td>Air ambulance ticket for registered service provider.</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>Emergency Evacuation Cover</td>\n'
  '<td>In the event of an Insured Person requiring Emergency evacuation and '
  'repatriation, the Insured Person must notify Us immediately either at Our '
  'call centre or in writing. Emergency medical evacuations shall be '
  'pre-authorised by Us. Our team of Specialists in association with the '
  'Emergency assistance service provider shall determine the medical necessity '
  'of such Emergency evacuation or repatriation post which the same will be '
  'approved.</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>Medical Equipment Cover</td>\n'
  '<td>Prescriptions of treating Specialist for support items and original '
  'invoice of actual Medical Expenses incurred.</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>Ultra-modern Treatment Cover</td>\n'
  '<td>Certificate by qualified medical surgeons indicating the medical '
  'necessity of the procedure.</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>Birth Control Procedure Cover</td>\n'
  "<td>All medical records and treating Medical Practitioner's certificate on "
  'the indication.</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>Infertility Treatment Cover</td>\n'
  '<td>Certificate from Specialist Medical Practitioner detailing the cause of '
  'infertility, Treatment, procedure.</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>Deductible (Aggregate/ Per-Claim)</td>\n'
  '<td>Any claim towards Hospitalisation during the Policy period must be '
  'submitted to Us for assessment in accordance with the claim process laid '
  'down under Clause VI of the Policy towards Cashless facility or '
  'reimbursement respectively in order to assess and determine the '
  'applicability of the Deductible on such claim. Once the claim has been '
  'assessed, if any amount becomes payable after applying the Deductible, We '
  'will assess and pay such claim in accordance with Clause VI.6 and 7 of the '
  'Policy. Wherever such Hospitalisation claims as stated under Clause VI '
  'above is being covered under another policy held by the Insured Person, We '
  'will assess the claim on available photocopies duly attested by the Insured '
  "Person's insurer / TPA as the case may be.</td>\n"
  '</tr>\n'
  '</table>\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  'We may call for any additional document/information as required based on '
  'the circumstances of the claim wherever the\n'
  'claim is under further investigation or available documents do not provide '
  'clarity.\n'
  '\n'

  '## Annexure-I\n'
  '\n'
  'slportal.uiic.in/Configurator/HTMLReportSource/rei3ckas5sidov552op4vm45UniGroupHealthInsurancePolicy_2025061921666.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '<table>\n'
  '<caption>Uni Group Health Insurance Policy List I - Optional '
  'Items</caption>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<th>Sr. No</th>\n'
  '<th>Item</th>\n'
  '<th>Payable / Not Payable</th>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>1</td>\n'
  '<td>BABY FOOD</td>\n'
  '<td>Not Payable</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>2</td>\n'
  '<td>BABY UTILITIES CHARGES</td>\n'
  '<td>Not Payable</td>\n',
  'was unavailable;\n'
  '\n'
  'iii. We shall not be liable to pay for any claim in connection with:\n'
  '\n'
  'a.Asthma, bronchitis, tonsillitis and upper respiratory tract infection '
  'including laryngitis and pharyngitis, cough and cold, influenza;\n'
  '\n'
  'b.Arthritis, gout and rheumatism;\n'
  '\n'
  'c. Chronic nephritis and nephritic syndrome;\n'
  '\n'
  'd.Diarrhoea and all type of dysenteries, including gastroenteritis;\n'
  '\n'
  'e. Diabetes mellitus and insipidus;\n'
  '\n'
  'f. Epilepsy;\n'
  '\n'
  'g.Hypertension;\n'
  '\n'
  'h.Psychiatric or psychosomatic disorders of all kinds;\n'
  '\n'
  'i. Pyrexia of unknown origin.\n'
  '\n'
  'All claims under this Benefit can be made as per the process defined under '
  'Clause VI.4\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 7.Donor Expenses Cover\n'
  '\n'
  'We will cover the In-patient Hospitalisation Medical Expenses incurred for '
  "an organ donor's treatment during the Policy Period for the\n"
  'harvesting of the organ donated up to the limit as specified in the Policy '
  'Schedule or Certificate of Insurance provided that:\n'
  '\n'
  'i. The donation conforms to The Transplantation of Human Organs Act 1994 '
  'and the organ is for the use of the Insured Person;\n'
  '\n'
  'ii. We have admitted a claim towards In-patient Hospitalisation under the '
  'Base Cover and it is related to the same condition; organ\n'
  'donated is for the use of the Insured Person as certified in writing by a '
  'Medical Practitioner;\n'
  '\n'
  'iii. We will not cover:\n'
  '\n'
  'a.Pre-hospitalisation Medical Expenses or Post-hospitalisation Medical '
  'Expenses of the organ donor;\n'
  '\n'
  'b.Screening expenses of the organ donor;\n'
  '\n'
  "c. Costs associated with the acquisition of the donor's organ;\n"
  '\n'
  'd. Transplant of any organ/tissue where the transplant is experimental or '
  'investigational;\n'
  '\n'
  'e. Expenses related to organ transportation or preservation;\n'
  '\n'
  'f. Any other medical treatment or complication in respect of the donor, '
  'consequent to harvesting.\n'
  '\n'
  'All claims under this Benefit can be made as per the process defined under '
  'Clause VI.3 and VI.4\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 8.Modern Treatment Methods & Advancement in Technologies:\n'
  '\n'
  'In case of an admissible claim under Clause III.A.1, expenses incurred on '
  'the following procedures (wherever medically indicated) either\n'
  'as in-patient or as part of day care treatment in a hospital, shall be '
  'covered. The claim shall be subject to additional sub-limits indicated\n'
  'against them in the table below:\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '<table>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<th>Sr. No.</th>\n'
  '<th>Modern Treatment Methods &amp; Advancement in Technology</th>\n'
  '<th>Limits per Surgery</th>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>1.</td>\n'
  '<td>Uterine Artery Embolization &amp; High Intensity Focussed Ultrasound '
  '(HIFU)</td>\n'
  '<td>up to the limit as specified in the Policy Schedule or Certificate of '
  'Insurance per policy period for claims involving Uterine Artery '
  'Embolization &amp; HIFU</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>2.</td>\n'
  '<td>Balloon Sinuplasty</td>\n'
  '<td>up to the limit as specified in the Policy Schedule or Certificate of '
  'Insurance per policy period for claims involving Balloon Sinuplasty</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>3.</td>\n'
  '<td>Deep Brain Stimulation</td>\n'
  '<td>up to the limit as specified in the Policy Schedule or Certificate of '
  'Insurance per policy period for claims involving Deep Brain '
  'Stimulation</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>4.</td>\n'
  '<td>Oral Chemotherapy</td>\n'
  '<td>up to the limit as specified in the Policy Schedule or Certificate of '
  'Insurance per policy period for claims involving Oral Chemotherapy</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>5.</td>\n'
  '<td>Immunotherapy- Monoclonal Antibody to be given as injection</td>\n'
  '<td>up to the limit as specified in the Policy Schedule or Certificate of '
  'Insurance per policy period</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>6.</td>\n'
  '<td>Intra vitreal Injections</td>\n'
  '<td>up to the limit as specified in the Policy Schedule or Certificate of '
  'Insurance per policy period</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>7.</td>\n'
  '<td>Robotic Surgeries (including Robotic Assisted Surgeries)</td>\n'

  'Insurance per policy period for claims involving Robotic Surgeries for (i) '
  'the treatment of any disease involving Central Nervous System irrespective '
  'of aetiology; (ii) Malignancies .up to the limit as specified in the Policy '
  'Schedule or Certificate of</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '</table>\n'

  '\n'
  '\n'
  'All claims under this Benefit can be made as per the process defined under '
  'Clause VI. 3 and 4\n'
  'There are Optional covers available with the Policy.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### IV.PERMANENT EXCLUSIONS & WAITING PERIODS\n'
  '\n'
  'All the Waiting Periods shall be applicable individually for each Insured '
  'Person and claims shall be assessed accordingly.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### A.WAITING PERIODS\n'
  '\n'
  'We shall not be liable to make any payment under this Policy caused by, '
  'based on, arising out of, relating to or howsoever attributable to\n'
  'any of the following:\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 1.Pre-Existing Disease Waiting Period (Code-Excl01)\n',
  '\n'
  '25.Charges related to a Hospital stay not expressly mentioned as being '
  'covered, including but not limited to charges for admission,\n'
  'discharge, administration, registration, documentation and filing, '
  'including MRD charges (medical records department charges).\n'
  '\n'
  '26.Any physical, medical or mental condition or Treatment or service that '
  'is specifically excluded in the Policy Schedule/ Certificate of\n'
  'Insurance under Special Conditions.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### V.TERMS AND CLAUSES\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### A.Standard Terms and Clauses\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '##### 1. Arbitration\n'
  '\n'
  'The parties to the contract may mutually agree and enter into a separate '
  'Arbitration Agreement to settle any and all disputes in relation\n'
  'to this policy. Arbitration shall be conducted under and in accordance with '
  'the provisions of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '##### 2. Disclosure of Information\n'
  '\n'
  'The policy shall be void and all premium paid thereon shall be forfeited to '
  'the Company in the event of misrepresentation,\n'
  'misdescription or non-disclosure of any material fact by the policyholder.\n'
  '\n'
  '(Explanation: "Material facts" for the purpose of this policy shall mean '
  'all relevant information sought by the Company in the proposal\n'
  'form and other connected documents to enable it to take informed decision '
  'in the context of underwriting the risk).\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 3. Condition Precedent to Admission of Liability\n'
  '\n'
  'The terms and conditions of the policy must be fulfilled by the Insured '
  'Person for the Company to make any payment for claim(s)\n'
  'arising under the policy.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 4. Claim Settlement (provision for Penal Interest)\n'
  '\n'
  'i. The Company shall settle or reject a claim, as the case may be, within '
  '15 days from the date of receipt of last necessary document.\n'
  'ii. In the case of delay in the payment of a claim, the Company shall be '
  'liable to pay interest to the Insured Person from the date of\n'
  'receipt of last necessary document to the date of payment of claim at a '
  'rate 2% above the bank rate.\n'
  '\n'
  'iii. However, where the circumstances of a claim warrant an investigation '
  'in the opinion of the Company, it shall initiate and complete\n'
  'such investigation at the earliest, in any case not later than 30 days from '
  'the date of receipt of last necessary document. In such cases,\n'
  'the Company shall settle or reject the claim within 45 days from the date '
  'of receipt of last necessary document.\n'
  '\n'
  'iv. In case of delay beyond stipulated 45 days, the Company shall be liable '
  'to pay interest to the Insured Person at a rate 2% above the\n'
  'bank rate from the date of receipt of last necessary document to the date '
  'of payment of claim.\n'
  '\n'
  '(Explanation: "Bank rate" shall mean the rate fixed by the Reserve Bank of '
  'India (RBI) at the beginning of the financial year in which\n'
  'claim has fallen due).\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 5. Complete Discharge\n'
  '\n'
  'Any payment to the Policyholder, Insured Person or his/her nominees or '
  'his/her legal representative or Assignee or to the Hospital, as\n'
  'the case may be, for any benefit under the Policy shall be a valid '
  'discharge towards payment of claim by the Company to the extent of\n'
  'that amount for the particular claim.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 6. Multiple Policies\n'
  '\n'
  'i. In case of multiple policies taken by an Insured Person during a period '
  'from one or more Insurers to indemnify treatment costs, the\n'
  'Insured Person can file for claim settlement as per his/her choice under '
  'any policy. The Insurer of that chosen policy shall be treated as\n'
  'the primary Insurer.\n'
  '\n'
  'ii. In case the available coverage under the said policy is less than the '
  'admissible claim amount, the primary Insurer shall seek the\n'
  'details of\n'
  '\n'
  'iii. other available policies of the policyholder and shall coordinate with '
  'other Insurers to ensure settlement of the balance amount\n'
  '\n'
  'iv. as per the policy conditions, provided a written request for same has '
  'been submitted by the Insured Person. policy.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 7. Fraud\n'
  '\n'
  'If any claim made by the Insured Person is in any respect fraudulent, or if '
  'any false statement, or declaration is made or used in\n'
  'support thereof, or if any fraudulent means or devices are used by the '
  'Insured Person or anyone acting on his/her behalf to obtain any\n'
  'benefit under this policy, all benefits under this policy and the premium '
  'paid shall be forfeited.\n'
  '\n'
  'Any amount already paid against claims made under this policy but which are '
  'found fraudulent later shall be repaid by all recipient(s)/\n'
  'Policyholder(s), who has made that particular claim, who shall be jointly '
  'and severally liable for such repayment to the Insurer.\n'
  '\n'
  'For the purpose of this clause, the expression "fraud" means any of the '
  'following acts committed by the Insured Person or by his agent\n'
  'or the hospital/doctor/ any other party acting on behalf of the Insured '
  'Person, with intent to deceive the Insurer or to induce the\n'
  'Insurer to issue an insurance policy:\n'
  '\n'
  'i. the suggestion, as a fact of that which is not true and which the '
  'Insured Person does not believe to be true;\n'
  '\n'
  'ii. the active concealment of a fact by the Insured Person having knowledge '
  'or belief of the fact;\n'
  '\n'
  'iii. any other act fitted to deceive; and\n'
  '\n'
  'iv. any such act or omission as the law specially declares to be '
  'fraudulent\n'
  '\n'
  'The Company shall not repudiate the claim and/ or forfeit the policy '
  'benefits on the ground of fraud, if the Insured Person/beneficiary\n'
  'can prove that the misstatement was true to the best of his knowledge and '
  'there was no deliberate intention to suppress the fact or\n'
  'that such misstatement of or suppression of material fact are within the '
  'knowledge of the Insurer.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 8. Cancellation\n'
  '\n'
  'i. The policyholder may policy at any time during the term, by giving 7 '
  "days' notice in writing. The Insurer shall refund proportionate\n"
  'premium for unexpired policy period.\n'
  '\n'
  'ii. if there is\n'
  '\n'
  'iii. no claim (s) reported during the policy period.\n'
  '\n'
  'iv. The Company may cancel the policy at any time on grounds of '
  'mis-representation, non-disclosure of material facts, fraud by the\n'
  "Insured Person, by giving iv. 7 days' written notice. There would be no "
  'refund of premium on cancellation on grounds of mis-\n'
  'representation, non-disclosure of material facts or fraud.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 9. Migration\n'
  '\n'
  'The Insured Person will be provided a facility to migrate the policy '
  '(including all members) to other health insurance products/plans\n'
  'offered by the company by applying for migration of the policy. If such '
  'person is presently covered and has been continuously covered\n'
  'without any lapses under any health insurance product/plan offered by the '
  'company, the Insured Person will get the accrued continuity\n'
  'benefits in waiting periods as per IRDAI guidelines on migration.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 10.Portability\n'
  '\n'
  'The Insured Person will be provided facility to port the policy to other '
  'Insurers by applying to such Insurer to port the entire policy\n'
  'along with all the members of the family, if any as per IRDAI guidelines '
  'related to portability. If such person is presently covered and\n'
  'has been continuously covered without any lapses under any health insurance '
  'policy with an Indian General/Health Insurer, the\n'
  'proposed Insured Person will get the accrued continuity benefits in waiting '
  'periods as per IRDAI guidelines on portability.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 11.Renewal of Policy\n'
  '\n'
  'The policy shall ordinarily be renewable except on grounds of fraud or '
  'non-disclosure or misrepresentation by the Insured Person.\n'
  '\n'
  'i. The Company will give notice for renewal.\n'
  '\n'
  'ii. Renewal shall not be denied on the ground that the Insured Person had '
  'made a claim or claims in the preceding policy years.\n'
  '\n'
  '<!-- '
  'PageFooter="https://slportal.uiic.in/Configurator/HTMLReportSource/rei3ckas5sidov552op4vm45UniGroupHealthInsurancePolicy_202506192166603PS.htm" '

  '..\n'
  '\n'
  'iii. Request for renewal along with requisite premium shall be received by '
  'the Company before the end of the policy period.\n',
  'Premium shall be refunded for all lives which have not registered a claim '
  'with Us under the Policy up to the date of cancellation.\n'
  '\n'
  '<!-- '
  'PageFooter="https://slportal.uiic.in/Configurator/HTMLReportSource/rei3ckas5sidov552op4vm45UniGroupHealthInsurancePolicy_202506192166603PS.htm" '

  '..\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 6. Role of Group Administrator/Policyholder\n'
  '\n'
  'i. The Policyholder should provide all the written information that is '
  'reasonably required to work out the premium and pay any claim/\n'
  'Benefit provided under the Policy including the complete list of members to '
  'Us at the time of policy issuance and renewal. Further\n'
  'intimation should be provided to Us on the entry and exit of the members at '
  'periodic intervals. Insurance will cease once the member\n'
  'leaves the group except when it is agreed in advance to continue the '
  'benefit even if the member leaves the group.\n'
  '\n'
  'ii. Material information to be disclosed includes every matter that the '
  'Insured Person and/or the Policyholder is aware of, or could\n'
  'reasonably be expected to know, that relates to questions in the RFQ/ '
  'proposal form and which is relevant to Us in order to accept the\n'
  'risk of insurance and if so on what terms. The Insured Person/ Policyholder '
  'must exercise the same duty to disclose those matters to Us\n'
  'before the Renewal, extension, variation, or endorsement of the Policy.\n'
  '\n'
  'iii. The Policy holder i.e. the Employer may issue confirmation of '
  'insurance protection to the individual employees with clear reference\n'
  'to the Group Insurance policy and the benefits secured thereby.\n'
  '\n'
  'iv. The claims of the individual employees may be processed through the '
  'employer.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 7. Alterations in the Policy\n'
  '\n'
  'This Policy constitutes the complete contract of insurance. No change or '
  'alteration will be effective or valid unless approved in writing\n'
  'which will be evidenced by a written endorsement, signed and stamped by Us. '
  'All endorsement requests will be made by the\n'
  'Policyholder only.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 8. Material Information for administration\n'
  '\n'
  'The Insured Person and/ or the Policyholder must give Us all the written '
  'information that is reasonably required to work out the\n'
  'premium and pay any claim/ Benefit provided under the Policy. You must give '
  'Us written notification specifying the details of the\n'
  'Insured Persons to be deleted and the details of the eligible persons '
  'proposed to be added to the Policy as Insured Persons.\n'
  '\n'
  'Material information to be disclosed includes every matter that the Insured '
  'Person and/or the Policyholder is aware of, or could\n'
  'reasonably be expected to know, that relates to questions in the proposal '
  'form and which is relevant to Us in order to accept the risk of\n'
  'insurance and if so on what terms. The Insured Person/ Policyholder must '
  'exercise the same duty to disclose those matters to Us\n'
  'before the Renewal, extension, variation or endorsement of the Policy.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 9. Material Change\n'
  '\n'
  'It is Condition Precedent to Our liability under the Policy that You shall '
  'at Your own expense immediately notify Us in writing of any\n'
  'material change in the risk on account of change in nature of occupation or '
  'business of any Insured Person. We may, in Our discretion,\n'
  'adjust the scope of cover and / or the premium paid or payable, '
  'accordingly.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 10.Fraud\n'
  '\n'
  'If any claim made by the Insured Person is in any respect fraudulent, or if '
  'any false statement, or declaration is made or used in\n'
  'support thereof, or if any fraudulent means or devices are used by the '
  'Insured Person or anyone acting on his/her behalf to obtain any\n'
  'benefit under this policy, all benefits under this policy and the premium '
  'paid shall be forfeited.\n'
  '\n'
  'Any amount already paid against claims made under this policy but which are '
  'found fraudulent later shall be repaid by all recipient(s)/\n'
  'Policyholder(s), who has made that particular claim, who shall be jointly '
  'and severally liable for such repayment to the Insurer.\n'
  '\n'
  'For the purpose of this clause, the expression "fraud" means any of the '
  'following acts committed by the Insured Person or by his agent\n'
  'or the hospital/doctor/ any other party acting on behalf of the Insured '
  'Person, with intent to deceive the Insurer or to induce the\n'
  'Insurer to issue an insurance policy:\n'
  '\n'
  'i. the suggestion, as a fact of that which is not true and which the '
  'Insured Person does not believe to be true;\n'
  '\n'
  'ii. the active concealment of a fact by the Insured Person having knowledge '
  'or belief of the fact;\n'
  '\n'
  'iii. any other act fitted to deceive; and\n'
  '\n'
  'iv. any such act or omission as the law specially declares to be '
  'fraudulent\n'
  '\n'
  'The Company shall not repudiate the claim and/ or forfeit the policy '
  'benefits on the ground of fraud, if the Insured Person/beneficiary\n'
  'can prove that the misstatement was true to the best of his knowledge and '
  'there was no deliberate intention to suppress the fact or\n'
  'that such misstatement of or suppression of material fact are within the '
  'knowledge of the Insurer.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 11.Geographical Area\n'
  '\n'
  'The geographical scope of this Policy applies to events limited to India '
  'unless specified under this Policy in a particular Benefit or\n'
  'definition. However, all admitted or payable claims shall be settled in '
  'India in Indian rupees.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 12.Addition and Deletion of a Member\n'
  '\n'
  'We shall include/exclude a group member/Employee of the Policyholder and/or '
  'his/her Dependent(s) as an Insured Person under the\n'
  'Policy in accordance with the following procedure:\n'
  '\n'
  'A. Additions\n'
  '\n'
  '· a. Employer - Employee Group:\n'
  '\n'
  '· i) Newly appointed employee and his/her dependents\n'
  '\n'
  '· ii) Newly wedded spouse of the employee,\n'
  '\n'
  '· iii) New born child of the employee\n'
  '\n'
  '. may be added to the Policy as an Insured Person during the Policy period '
  'provided that the application for cover has been accepted\n'
  'by Us, additional premium on pro-rata basis applied on the risk coverage '
  'duration for the Insured Person has been received by Us and\n'
  'We have issued an endorsement confirming the addition of such person as an '
  'Insured Person\n'
  '\n'
  '. b. Non-Employer - Employee Group: As specified in the Policy Schedule\n'
  '\n'
  'B. Deletions:\n'
  '\n'
  '. a. Employer - Employee Group\n'
  '\n'
  'i) Employee leaving the company/organization on account of '
  'resignation/retirement/termination and his/her dependents shall be\n'
  'deleted from the policy effective from the date of '
  'resignation/retirement/termination or till the last day of the month of\n'
  'resignation/retirement/termination at the option of the insured\n'
  '\n'
  'ii) In the event of death of an employee, his/her dependents may continue '
  'to be covered until the expiry of the policy period at the\n'
  'option of the insured\n'
  '\n'
  '. b. Non-Employer - Employee Group: As specified in the Policy Schedule\n'
  '\n'
  'Refund of premium shall be made on a pro-rata basis, provided that no claim '
  'is paid/outstanding in respect of that Insured Person or\n'
  'his/her Dependents.\n'
  '\n'
  'Throughout the Policy period, the Policyholder will notify Us of all and '
  'any changes in the membership of the Policy occurring in a month\n'
  'on or before the last day of the succeeding month.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 13.Endorsements\n'
  '\n'
  'The Policy will allow the following endorsements during the Policy period. '
  'Any request for endorsement must be made only in writing by\n'
  'the Policyholder. Any endorsement would be effective from the date of the '
  'request received from You, or the date of receipt of\n'
  'premium, whichever is later.\n'
  '\n'
  '· Rectification in name of the proposer / Insured Person.\n'
  '\n'
  '· Rectification in gender of the proposer/ Insured Person.\n'
  '\n'
  '. Rectification in relationship of the Insured Person with the proposer.\n'
  '\n'
  '· Rectification of age/ date of birth of the Insured Person\n'
  '\n'
  '. Change in the correspondence address of the proposer.\n',
  '\n'
  '· Change/updating in the contact details viz., phone number, E-mail ID, '
  'etc.\n'
  '\n'
  '· Updating of alternate contact address of the proposer.\n'
  '\n'
  '· Change in Nominee details.\n'
  '\n'
  '· Deletion of Insured Person on death or upon leaving the group provided no '
  'claims are paid / outstanding.\n'
  '\n'
  '· Addition of member (New Born Baby or newly wedded Spouse).\n'
  '\n'
  'All endorsement requests shall be assessed by the underwriter and where '
  'required additional information/documents/ premium may be\n'
  'requested.\n'
  '\n'

  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 14.Renewal Terms\n'
  '\n'
  'Alterations like increase/ decrease in Sum Insured or change in optional '
  'covers can be requested at the time of Renewal of the Policy.\n'
  'We reserve Our right to carry out assessment of the group and provide the '
  'Renewal quote in respect of the revised Policy.\n'
  'We may in Our sole discretion, revise the premiums payable under the Policy '
  'or the terms of the cover, provided that all such changes\n'
  'are in accordance with the IRDAI rules and regulations as applicable from '
  'time to time.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 15.Our Right of Termination\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### A. Termination of Policy:\n'
  '\n'
  'Prior to the expiry of the Policy as shown in the Policy Schedule/ '
  'Certificate of Insurance, cover will end immediately for all Insured\n'
  'Persons, if:\n'
  '\n'
  'i. there is misrepresentation, fraud, non-disclosure of material fact by '
  'You / Insured Person without any refund of premium, by giving\n'
  "15 days' notice in writing by Registered Post Acknowledgment Due / recorded "
  'delivery to Your last known address.\n'
  '\n'
  'ii. there is non-cooperation by You/ Insured person, with refund of premium '
  'on pro rata basis for all lives which have not registered a\n'
  "claim with Us, after deducting Our expenses, by giving 15 days' notice in "
  'writing by Registered Post Acknowledgment Due / recorded\n'
  'delivery to Your last known address.\n'
  '\n'
  'iii. the Policyholder does not pay the premiums owed under the Policy '
  'within the Grace Period.\n'
  '\n'
  'Upon termination, cover and services under the Policy shall end '
  'immediately. Treatment and costs incurred after the date of termination\n'
  'shall not be paid. If Treatment has been authorized or an approval for '
  'Cashless facility has been issued, we will not be held responsible\n'
  'for any Treatment costs if the Policy ends. However, we will be liable to '
  'pay in respect of all claims where the Treatment/admission has\n'
  'commenced before the date of termination of such Policy.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  "### B.Termination for Insured Person's cover\n"
  '\n'
  'Cover will end for a Member or dependent:\n'
  '\n'
  'i. If the Policyholder stops paying premiums for the Insured Person(s) and '
  'their Dependents (if any);\n'
  '\n'
  'ii. When this Policy terminates at the expiry of the period shown in the '
  'Policy Schedule/ Certificate of Insurance.\n'
  '\n'
  'iii. If he or she dies;\n'
  '\n'
  'iv. When a dependent insured person ceases to be a Dependent; unless '
  'otherwise agreed specifically for continuation till end of policy\n'
  'period;\n'
  '\n'
  'v. If the Insured Person ceases to be a member of the group.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 16.Limitation of Liability\n'
  '\n'
  'If a claim is rejected or partially settled and is not the subject of any '
  'pending suit or other proceeding, as the case may be, within\n'
  'twelve months from the date of such rejection or settlement, the claim '
  'shall be deemed to have been abandoned and Our liability shall\n'
  'be extinguished and shall not be recoverable thereafter.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 17.Operation of Policy & Certificate of Insurance\n'
  '\n'
  'The Policy shall be issued for the duration as specified in the Policy '
  'Schedule/ Certificate of Insurance. The Policy takes effect on the\n'
  'Inception Date stated in the Policy Schedule and/or the Certificate of '
  'Insurance and ends on the date of expiry of the Policy. For specific\n'
  'groups, upon request, all additions thereto by way of Certificate/s of '
  'Insurance shall be valid up to the Policy Period commencing from\n'
  'the actual date of addition to the Policy, it being agreed and understood '
  'that We shall continue to extend the benefit of coverage of\n'
  'insurance to the Insured Person(s) in the same manner on Renewal of the '
  'Policy or until expiry of the Certificate of Insurance,\n'
  'whichever is later.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 18.Electronic Transactions\n'
  '\n'
  'The Policyholder/ Insured Person agrees to comply with all the terms and '
  'conditions as We shall prescribe from time to time, and\n'
  'confirms that all transactions effected facilities for conducting remote '
  'transactions such as the internet, World Wide Web, electronic\n'
  'data interchange, call centers, tele-service operations (whether voice, '
  'video, data or combination thereof) or by means of electronic,\n'
  'computer, automated machines network or through other means of '
  'telecommunication, in respect of this Policy, or Our other services,\n'
  'shall constitute legally binding when done in compliance with Our terms for '
  'such facilities.\n'
  '\n'
  'Sales through such electronic transactions shall ensure that all conditions '
  'of Section 41 of the Insurance Act, 1938 prescribed for the\n'
  'proposal form and all necessary disclosures on terms and conditions and '
  'exclusions are made known to the Policyholder/ Insured\n'
  'Person. A voice recording in case of tele-sales or other evidence for sales '
  'through the World Wide Web shall be maintained and such\n'
  'consent will be subsequently validated / confirmed by the Policyholder/ '
  'Insured Person.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 19.Communications & Notices\n'
  '\n'
  'a) Any notice, direction or instruction or any other communication related '
  'to the Policy should be made in writing.\n'
  '\n'
  'b) Such communication shall be sent to the address of the Company or '
  'through any other electronic modes at contact address as\n'
  'specified in the Policy Schedule.\n'
  '\n'
  'c) No insurance agents, brokers, other person or entity is authorized to '
  'receive any notice on behalf of Us unless explicitly stated in\n'
  'writing by Us.\n'
  '\n'
  'd) The Company shall communicate to The Policyholder/ Insured Person in '
  'writing, at the address as specified in the Policy Schedule/\n'
  'Certificate of Insurance or through any other electronic mode at the '
  'contact address as specified in the policy schedule\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 20. Territorial Jurisdiction\n'
  '\n'
  'All disputes or differences under or in relation to the interpretation of '
  'the terms, conditions, validity, construct, limitations and/or\n'
  'exclusions contained in the policy shall be determined by the Indian court '
  'and according to Indian law.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### VI.CLAIM PROCEDURE\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### d.A.Claim Process for Base Covers\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 1.Claims Administration & Process\n'
  '\n'
  '1\\. Claims Administration & Process\n'
  '\n'
  'It shall be the condition precedent to admission of Our liability under '
  'this Policy that the terms and conditions of making the payment of\n'
  'premium in full and on time, insofar as they relate to anything to be done '
  'or complied with by You or any Insured Person, are fulfilled\n'
  'including complying with the following in relation to claims:\n'
  '\n'
  '1\\. On the occurrence or discovery of any Illness or Injury that may give '
  'rise to a Claim under this Policy, the Claims Procedure set out\n'
  'below shall be followed.\n'
  '\n'
  '2\\. The treatment should be taken as per the directions, advice and '
  'guidance of the treating Medical Practitioner. Any failure to follow\n'
  'such directions, Medical advice or guidance will prejudice the claim.\n'
  '\n'
  '3\\. The Insured Person must submit to medical examination by Our Medical '
  'Practitioner or our authorized representative in case\n'
  'requested by Us and at Our cost, as often as We consider reasonable and '
  'necessary and We/Our representatives must be permitted to\n'
  'inspect the medical and Hospitalisation records pertaining to the Insured '
  "Person's treatment and to investigate the circumstances\n"
  'pertaining to the claim.\n'
  '\n'
  '4\\. We and Our representatives must be given all reasonable co-operation '
  'in investigating the claim in order to assess Our liability and\n'
  'quantum in respect of the claim.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 2. Notification of claim\n'],
 ['of a Medical Practitioner and are incurred on Medically Necessary Treatment '
  'of the Insured Person.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 1.In-patient Hospitalisation Expenses Cover\n'
  '\n'
  'We will pay the Reasonable and Customary Charges for the following Medical '
  'Expenses of an Insured Person in case of Medically\n'
  'Necessary Treatment taken during Hospitalisation provided that the '
  'admission date of the Hospitalisation due to Illness or Injury is\n'
  'within the Policy period:\n'
  '\n'
  'A. Room, Boarding and Nursing expenses as provided by the Hospital/Nursing '
  'Home up to the category/limit specified in the Policy\n'
  'Schedule/ Certificate of Insurance or actual expenses incurred, whichever '
  'is less, including nursing care, RMO charges, IV Fluids/Blood\n'
  'transfusion/injection administration charges and similar expenses.\n'
  '\n'
  'B. Charges for accommodation in ICU/CCU/HDU up to the category/limit '
  'specified in the Policy Schedule/ Certificate of Insurance or actual\n'
  'expenses incurred, whichever is less,\n'
  '\n'
  'C. Operation theatre cost,\n'
  '\n'
  'D.Anaesthestics, Blood, Oxygen, Surgical Appliances and/ or Medical '
  'Appliances, Cost of Artificial Limbs, cost of prosthetic devices\n'
  'implanted during surgical procedure like pacemaker, orthopaedic implants, '
  'infra cardiac valve replacements, vascular stents, and other\n'
  'medical expenses related to the treatment.\n'
  '\n'
  'E. The fees charged by the Medical Practitioner, Surgeon, Specialists and '
  'Anaesthetists treating the Insured Person;\n'
  '\n'
  'F. Medicines, drugs and other allowable consumables prescribed by the '
  'treating Medical Practitioner;\n'
  '\n'
  'G.Cost of Investigative tests or diagnostic procedures directly related to '
  'the Injury/Illness for which the Insured Person is hospitalised\n'
  'such as but not limited to Radiology, Pathology tests, X-rays, MRI and CT '
  'Scans, Physiotherapy.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### Note 1:\n'
  '\n'
  'Proportionate Clause: In case of admission to a room at rates exceeding the '
  'limits mentioned in the Policy Schedule/Certificate of\n'
  'Insurance (for Clause III.A.1.A), the reimbursement/payment of all '
  'associated medical expenses incurred at the Hospital shall be\n'
  'effected in the same proportion as the admissible rate per day bears to the '
  'actual rate per day of Room Rent. Proportionate Deductions\n'
  'shall not be applied in respect of those hospitals where differential '
  'billing is not followed or for those expenses where differential billing\n'
  'is not adopted based on the room category.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### Note 2:\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### Mental Illness Cover Limit:\n'
  '\n'
  'In case of following mental illnesses the Inpatient Hospitalisation benefit '
  'will be covered up to the limit as mentioned in the schedule;\n'
  '\n'
  '1.Schizophrenia (ICD - F20; F21; F25)\n'
  '\n'
  '2.Bipolar Affective Disorders (ICD - F31; F34)\n'
  '\n'
  '3.Depression (ICD - F32; F33)\n'
  '\n'
  '4.Obsessive Compulsive Disorders (ICD - F42; F60.5)\n'
  '\n'
  '5.Psychosis (ICD - F 22; F23; F28; F29)\n'
  '\n'
  'All claims under this Benefit can be made as per the process defined under '
  'Clause VI. 3 and 4\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 2.Day Care Treatment Cover\n'
  '\n'
  "We will cover the Medical Expenses incurred on the Insured Person's Day "
  'Care Treatment (as defined in Clause II.A.11) during the Policy\n'
  'Period following an Illness or Injury that occurs during the Policy Period '
  'provided the Day Care Treatment is for Medically Necessary\n'
  'Treatment and follows the written Medical Advice.\n'
  '\n'
  'The benefit under the policy will be limited to the amount specified in the '
  'Policy Schedule/ Certificate of Insurance, whichever is less.\n'
  'All claims under this Benefit can be made as per the process defined under '
  'Clause VI.3 and VI.4\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 3.Pre - hospitalisation Medical Expenses Cover\n'
  '\n'
  "We will cover, on a reimbursement basis, the Insured Person's "
  'Pre-hospitalisation Medical Expenses incurred due to an Illness or Injury\n'
  'that occurs during the Policy Period up to the number of days and up to the '
  'amount limit as specified in the Policy Schedule or Certificate\n'
  'of Insurance Or actual expenses incurred, whichever is less, provided '
  'that:\n'
  '\n'

  'PageFooter="https://slportal.uiic.in/Configurator/HTMLReportSource/rei3ckas5sidov552op4vm45UniGroupHealthInsurancePolicy_202506192166603PS.htm" '

  '..\n'
  '\n'
  '(i) We have accepted a claim for In-patient Hospitalisation under Clause '
  'III.A.1 or III.A.2 above;\n'
  '\n'
  '(ii) The Pre-hospitalisation Medical Expenses are related to the same '
  'Illness or Injury.\n'
  '\n'
  '(iii)The date of admission to the Hospital for the purpose of this Benefit '
  "shall be the date of the Insured Person's first admission to the\n"
  'Hospital in relation to the same Any One Illness.\n'
  '\n'
  'All claims under this Benefit can be made as per the process defined under '
  'Clause VI.4\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 4.Post - hospitalisation Medical Expenses Cover\n'
  '\n'
  "We will cover, on a reimbursement basis, the Insured Person's "
  'Post-hospitalisation Medical Expenses incurred following an Illness or\n'
  'Injury that occurs during the Policy Period up to the number of days and up '
  'to the amount limit as specified in the Policy Schedule or\n'
  'Certificate of Insurance, provided that:\n'
  '\n'
  '(i) We have accepted a claim for In-patient Hospitalisation under Clause '
  'III.A.1 or III.A.2 above;\n'
  '\n'
  '(ii) The Pre-hospitalisation Medical Expenses are related to the same '
  'Illness or Injury.\n'
  '\n'
  '(iii)The date of discharge from the Hospital for the purpose of this '
  "Benefit shall be the date of the Insured Person's last discharge from\n"
  'the Hospital in relation to the same Any One Illness for which We have '
  'accepted an In-patient Hospitalisation claim under Clause\n'
  'III.A.1 or III.A.2 above.\n'
  '\n'
  'All claims under this Benefit can be made as per the process defined under '
  'Clause VI.4\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 5.Road Ambulance Cover\n'
  '\n'
  'We will cover the costs incurred up to the limit as specified in the Policy '
  'Schedule or Certificate of Insurance on transportation of the\n'
  'Insured Person by road Ambulance to a Hospital for treatment in an '
  'Emergency following an Illness or Injury which occurs during the\n'
  'Policy Period. It becomes payable if a claim has been admitted under Clause '
  'III.A.1 or III.A.2 and the expenses are related to the same\n'
  'Illness or Injury.\n'
  '\n'
  'We will also cover the costs incurred on transportation of the Insured '
  'Person by road Ambulance in the following circumstances up to the\n'
  'limits specified in the Policy Schedule or Certificate of Insurance:\n'
  '\n'
  '(i) it is medically required to transfer the Insured Person to another '
  'Hospital or diagnostic centre during the course of Hospitalisation for\n'
  'advanced diagnostic treatment in circumstances where such facility is not '
  'available in the existing Hospital;\n'
  '\n'
  '(ii)it is medically required to transfer the Insured Person to another '
  'Hospital during the course of Hospitalisation due to lack of speciality\n'
  'treatment in the existing Hospital.\n'
  '\n'
  'All claims under this Benefit can be made as per the process defined under '
  'Clause VI.4\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 6.Domiciliary Hospitalisation Cover\n'
  '\n'
  'We will cover Medical Expenses, up to the limit specified in the Policy '
  'Schedule/ Certificate of Insurance, incurred for the Insured\n'
  "Person's Domiciliary Hospitalisation during the Policy Period following an "
  'Illness or Injury that occurs during the Policy Period provided\n'
  'that:\n'
  '\n'
  'i. The Domiciliary Hospitalisation continues for at least 3 consecutive '
  'days in which case We will make payment under this Benefit in\n'
  'respect of Medical Expenses incurred from the first day of Domiciliary '
  'Hospitalisation;\n'
  '\n'
  'ii. The treating Medical Practitioner confirms in writing that Domiciliary '
  "Hospitalisation was medically required and the Insured Person's\n"
  'condition was such that the Insured Person could not be transferred to a '
  'Hospital or the Insured Person satisfies Us that a Hospital bed\n',
  '\n'
  '37.Post-hospitalisation Medical Expenses means medical expenses incurred '
  'during pre-defined number of days immediately after the\n'
  'insured person is discharged from the hospital provided that:\n'
  '\n'
  '61.i.i. Such Medical Expenses are for the same condition for which the '
  "insured person's hospitalisation was required, and\n"
  '\n'
  '61.i.ii. The inpatient hospitalisation claim for such hospitalisation is '
  'admissible by the insurance company.\n'
  '\n'
  '38.Qualified Nurse means a person who holds a valid registration from the '
  'Nursing Council of India or the Nursing Council of any state in\n'
  'India.\n'
  '\n'
  '39.Reasonable and Customary Charges means the charges for services or '
  'supplies, which are the standard charges for the specific\n'
  'provider and consistent with the prevailing charges in the geographical '
  'area for identical or similar services, taking into account the\n'
  'nature of the illness / injury involved.\n'
  '\n'
  '40.Renewal means the terms on which the contract of insurance can be '
  'renewed on mutual consent with a provision of grace period for\n'
  'treating the renewal continuous for the purpose of gaining credit for '
  'pre-existing diseases, time-bound exclusions and for all waiting\n'
  'periods.\n'
  '\n'
  '41.Room Rent means the amount charged by a Hospital towards Room and '
  'Boarding expenses and shall include the associated medical\n'
  'expenses.\n'
  '\n'
  '42.Surgery or Surgical Procedure means manual and / or operative procedure '
  '(s) required for treatment of an illness or injury,\n'
  'correction of deformities and defects, diagnosis and cure of diseases, '
  'relief from suffering and prolongation of life, performed in a\n'
  'hospital or day care Centre by a medical practitioner.\n'
  '\n'
  '43.Unproven/Experimental Treatment means the treatment, including drug '
  'experimental therapy, which is not based on established\n'
  'medical practice in India, is treatment experimental or unproven.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### B.Specific Definitions\n'
  '\n'
  '1.Age or Aged means age of the Insured Person on last birthday as on date '
  'of commencement of the Policy.\n'
  '\n'

  '..\n'
  '\n'
  '2.Alternative Treatments are forms of Treatments other than "Allopathy", '
  '"AYUSH" or "modern medicine".\n'
  '\n'
  '3.Annexure means a document attached and marked as Annexure to this '
  'Policy.\n'
  '\n'
  '4.Ambulance means a road vehicle operated by a licensed/authorized service '
  'provider and equipped for the transport and paramedical\n'
  'Treatment of the person requiring medical attention.\n'
  '\n'
  '5.Associated Medical Expenses means hospitalisation related expenses on '
  'Surgeon, Anesthetist, Medical Practitioner, Consultants and\n'
  'Specialist Fees whether paid directly to the treating doctor / surgeon or '
  'to the hospital; Anesthesia, blood, oxygen, operation theatre\n'
  'charges, surgical appliances and such other similar expenses with the '
  'exception of:\n'
  '\n'
  'a.cost of pharmacy and consumables medicines\n'
  '\n'
  'b.cost of implants/medical devices\n'
  '\n'
  'c. cost of diagnostics\n'
  '\n'
  'The scope of this definition is limited to admissible claims where a '
  'proportionate deduction is applicable, as per Note 1 of\n'
  'Clause III.A.1.\n'
  '\n'
  '6\\. AYUSH Treatment means hospitalisation treatment given under Ayurveda, '
  'Yoga, Naturopathy, Unani, Siddha and Homeopathy\n'
  'systems.\n'
  '\n'
  '7\\. Benefit means any benefit shown in the Policy Schedule and/or '
  'Certificate of Insurance.\n'
  '\n'
  '8\\. Base Sum Insured means the Sum Insured for the Base Cover as specified '
  'in the Policy Schedule and/or Certificate of Insurance.\n'
  '\n'
  '9\\. Break in Policy means the period of gap that occurs at the end of the '
  'existing policy term/installment premium due date, when the\n'
  'premium due for renewal on a given policy or installment premium due is not '
  'paid on or before the premium renewal date or grace\n'
  'period.\n'
  '\n'
  '10.Certificate of Insurance means the certificate We issue to the Insured '
  "Person outlining the Insured Person's cover under the Policy.\n"
  '\n'
  '11.Clinical Psychologist means a persona€" (i) having a recognised '
  'qualification in Clinical Psychology from an institution approved and\n'
  'recognised, by the Rehabilitation Council of India, constituted under '
  'section 3 of the Rehabilitation Council of India Act, 1992 (34 of\n'
  '1992); or (ii) having a Post-Graduate degree in Psychology or Clinical '
  'Psychology or Applied Psychology and a Master of Philosophy in\n'
  'Clinical Psychology or Medical and Social Psychology obtained after '
  'completion of a full-time course of two years which includes\n'
  'supervised clinical training from any University recognised by the '
  'University Grants Commission established under the University Grants\n'
  'Commission Act, 1956 (3 of 1956) and approved and recognised by the '
  'Rehabilitation Council of India Act, 1992 (34 of 1992) or such\n'
  'recognised qualifications as may be prescribed.\n'
  '\n'
  '12.Co-Morbidity is the presence of one or more additional conditions '
  'co-occurring with a primary condition; in the countable sense of the\n'
  'term, a comorbidity is each additional condition.\n'
  '\n'
  '13.Cosmetic Surgery means Surgery or medical Treatment that modifies, '
  'improves, restores or maintains normal appearance of a\n'
  'physical feature, irregularity, or defect.\n'
  '\n'
  '14.Dentist means a dentist, dental surgeon or dental practitioner who is '
  'registered or licensed as such under the laws of the country,\n'
  'state or other regulated area in which the Treatment is provided.\n'
  '\n'
  '15.Effective Date means the date shown on the Certificate of Insurance on '
  'which the Insured Person was first included under the Policy.\n'
  '\n'
  '16.Eligibility means the provisions of the Policy that state the '
  'requirements to be complied with.\n'
  '\n'
  '17.Employee means any member of Your staff who is proposed and sponsored by '
  'You and who becomes an Insured Person under this\n'
  'Policy.\n'
  '\n'
  '18.Emergency shall mean a serious medical condition or symptom resulting '
  'from Injury or sickness which arises suddenly and\n'
  'unexpectedly, and requires immediate care and treatment by a Medical '
  'Practitioner, generally received within 24 hours of onset to\n'
  'avoid jeopardy to life or serious long term impairment of the Insured '
  "Person's health, until stabilization at which time this medical\n"
  'condition or symptom is not considered an emergency anymore.\n'
  '\n'
  '19.Exclusions mean specified coverage, hazards, services, conditions, and '
  'the like that are not provided for (covered) under a particular\n'
  'health insurance contract.\n'
  '\n'
  '20.Home nursing is arranged by the Hospital for a Qualified Nurse to visit '
  "the patient's home to give expert nursing services immediately\n"
  'after Hospital Treatment for as long as is required by medical necessity, '
  'visits for as long as is required by medical necessity for\n'
  'Treatment which would normally be provided in a Hospital. In either case, '
  'the Specialist who treated the patient must have\n'
  'recommended these services.\n'
  '\n'
  '21.Inception Date means the inception date of this Policy as specified in '
  'the Policy Schedule or Certificate of Insurance when the\n'
  'coverage under the Policy commences.\n'
  '\n'
  '22.In-patient means an Employee/ Member or Dependent who is admitted to a '
  'Hospital and stays for at least 24 hours for the sole\n'
  'purpose of receiving Treatment.\n'
  '\n'
  '23.Insured Person means the Employee/ Member and/or Dependents named in the '
  'Policy Schedule/ Certificate of Insurance, who is /\n'
  'are covered under this Policy, for whom the insurance is proposed and the '
  'appropriate premium is paid.\n'
  '\n'
  '24.IRDAI means the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of '
  'India.\n'
  '\n'
  '25.Medical Assistance Service is a service which provides Medical Advice, '
  'evacuation, assistance and repatriation. This service can be\n'
  'multi-lingual and is available 24 hours a day.\n'
  '\n'
  '26.Mental Illness means a substantial disorder of thinking, mood, '
  'perception, orientation or memory that grossly impairs judgment,\n'
  'behaviour, capacity to recognise reality or ability to meet the ordinary '
  'demands of life, mental conditions associated with the abuse of\n'
  'alcohol and drugs, but does not include mental retardation which is a '
  'condition of arrested or incomplete development of mind of a\n'
  'person, especially characterised by subnormality of intelligence\n',
  '<td>Within 15 (fifteen) days of date of discharge from hospital</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '<tr>\n'
  '<td>Reimbursement of post hospitalisation expenses</td>\n'
  '<td>Within 15 (fifteen) days from completion of post hospitalisation '
  'treatment</td>\n'
  '</tr>\n'
  '</table>\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### Note:\n'
  '\n'
  'a.i.1. The company shall only accept bills/invoices/medical treatment '
  "related documents only in the Insured Person's name for whom\n"
  'the claim is submitted.\n'
  '\n'
  'a.i.2. Waiver of clause V.B.4.v may be considered in extreme cases of '
  'hardship where it is proved to the satisfaction of the Company\n'
  'that under the circumstances in which the Insured was placed it was not '
  'possible for him or any other person to give such notice or file\n'
  'claim within the prescribed time-limit.\n'
  '\n'
  'a.i.3. The Insured Person shall also give the TPA / Company such additional '
  'information and assistance as the TPA / Company may\n'
  'require in dealing with the claim including an authorisation to obtain '
  'Medical and other records from the hospital, lab, etc.\n'
  '\n'
  'a.i.4. All the documents submitted to TPA shall be electronically collected '
  'by us for settlement/denial of the claims by the appropriate\n'
  'authority.\n'
  '\n'
  'a.i.5. Any medical practitioner or Authorised Person authorised by the TPA '
  '/ Company shall be allowed to examine the Insured Person in\n'
  'case of any alleged injury or disease leading to Hospitalisation if so '
  'required.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 6. Scrutiny of Claim Documents\n'
  '\n'
  'a. TPA/ We shall scrutinize the claim form and the accompanying documents. '
  'Any deficiency in the documents shall be intimated to the\n'
  'Insured Person/ Network Provider as the case may be.\n'
  '\n'
  'If the deficiency in the necessary claim documents is not met or is '
  'partially met in 10 working days of the first intimation. We will send\n'
  'a maximum of 3 (three) reminders. We may, at Our sole discretion, decide to '
  'deduct the amount of claim for which deficiency is\n'
  'intimated to the Insured Person and settle the claim if we observe that '
  'such a claim is otherwise valid under the Policy.\n'
  '\n'
  'b. In case a reimbursement claim is received when a pre-authorisation '
  'letter has been issued, before approving such a claim, a check\n'
  '\n'
  '<!-- '
  'PageFooter="https://slportal.uiic.in/Configurator/HTMLReportSource/rei3ckas5sidov552op4vm45UniGroupHealthInsurancePolicy_202506192166603PS.htm" '
  '-->\n'
  '<!-- PageNumber="30/37" -->\n'
  '<!-- PageBreak -->\n'
  '\n'
  '6/24/25, 5:21 PM\n'
  '\n'
  'slportal.uiic.in/Configurator/HTMLReportSource/rei3ckas5sidov552op4vm45UniGroupHealthInsurancePolicy_2025061921666 '
  '...\n'
  '\n'
  'will be made with the Network Provider whether the pre-authorisation has '
  'been utilized as well as whether the Insured Person has\n'
  'settled all the dues with the Network Provider. Once such check and '
  'declaration is received from the Network Provider, the case will be\n'
  'processed.\n'
  '\n'
  'c. The Pre-Hospitalisation Medical Expenses Cover claim and Post- '
  'Hospitalisation Medical Expenses Cover claim shall be processed only\n'
  'after decision of the main Hospitalisation claim.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 7. Claim Assessment\n'
  '\n'
  'We will pay the fixed or indemnity amount as specified in the applicable '
  'Base or Optional cover in accordance with the terms of this\n'
  'Policy.\n'
  '\n'
  'We will assess all admissible claims under the Policy in the following '
  'progressive order:\n'
  '\n'
  '1\\. Application of Proportionate clause as per Note 1 of clause III.A.1.\n'
  '\n'
  '2\\. Co-pay as applicable.\n'
  '\n'
  '3\\. Limit/ Sub Limit on Medical Expenses are applicable as specified in '
  'the Policy Schedule/ Certificate of Insurance\n'
  '\n'
  '4\\. Opted Deductible (Per claim/ Aggregate)\n'
  '\n'
  'Claim Assessment for Benefit Plans:\n'
  '\n'
  'We will pay fixed benefit amounts as specified in the Policy Schedule/ '
  'Certificate of Insurance in accordance with the terms of this\n'
  'Policy. We are not liable to make any reimbursements of Medical Expenses or '
  'pay any other amounts not specified in the Policy.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 8. Claim Rejection/ Repudiation\n'
  '\n'
  'If the company, for any reasons, decides to reject a claim under the '
  'policy, we shall communicate to the insured person in writing\n'
  'explicitly mentioning the grounds for rejection/repudiation and within a '
  'period of 15 (thirty) days from the receipt of the final\n'
  'document(s) or investigation report (if any), as the case may be. Where a '
  'rejection is communicated by Us, the Insured Person may, if\n'
  'so desired, within 15 days from the date of receipt of the claims decision '
  'represent to Us for reconsideration of the decision.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 9. Claim Payment Terms\n'
  '\n'
  'i. We shall have no liability to make payment of a claim under the Policy '
  'in respect of an Insured Person once the Sum Insured for that\n'
  'Insured Person is exhausted.\n'
  '\n'
  'All claims will be payable in India and in Indian rupees.\n'
  '\n'
  'ii. We are not obliged to make payment for any claim or that part of any '
  'claim that could have been avoided or reduced if the Insured\n'
  'Person could have reasonably minimized the costs incurred, or that is '
  'brought about or contributed to by the Insured Person by failing\n'
  'to follow the directions, Medical Advice or guidance provided by a Medical '
  'Practitioner.\n'
  '\n'
  'iii. The Sum Insured opted under the Policy shall be reduced by the amount '
  'payable / paid under the Policy terms and conditions and\n'
  'any optional covers applicable under the Policy and only the balance shall '
  'be available as the Sum Insured for the unexpired Policy\n'
  'Period.\n'
  '\n'
  'iv. If the Insured Person suffers a relapse within 45 days from the date of '
  'discharge from the Hospital for which a claim has been made,\n'
  'then such relapse shall be deemed to be part of the same claim and all the '
  'limits for "Any one illness" under this Policy shall be applied\n'
  'as if they were under a single claim.\n'
  '\n'
  'v. For Cashless claims, the payment shall be made to the Network Provider '
  'whose discharge would be complete and final.\n'
  '\n'
  'vi. For Reimbursement claims, the payment shall be made to the Insured '
  "Person. In the unfortunate event of the Insured Person's\n"
  'death, we will pay the Nominee (as named in the Policy Schedule/ '
  'Certificate of Insurance) and in case of no Nominee, to the legal heir\n'
  'who holds a succession certificate or indemnity bond to that effect, '
  'whichever is available and whose discharge shall be treated as full\n'
  'and final discharge of Our liability under the Policy.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 10.Services offered by TPA\n'
  '\n'
  'Servicing of claims i.e., claim admissions and assessments, under this '
  'Policy by way of preauthorization of cashless treatment or\n'
  'processing of claims, as per the terms and conditions of the policy.\n'
  '\n'
  'The services offered by a TPA shall not include:\n'
  '\n'
  'a) Claim settlement and claim rejection;\n'
  '\n'
  'b) Any services directly to any Insured Person or to any other person '
  'unless such service is in accordance with the terms and\n'
  'conditions of the Agreement entered into with the Company.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### 11.Payment of Claim\n'
  '\n'
  'All claims under the policy shall be payable in Indian currency only.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### d.B.Claim Process for Optional Covers\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '#### 1. Claim Intimation\n'
  '\n'
  'In addition to the claim intimation process set out in the Base Cover, the '
  'following conditions apply in relation to the respective\n'
  'Options. Upon the discovery or occurrence of an Accident/ Critical Illness '
  'or any other contingency that may give rise to a claim under\n'
  'this Policy, then as a Condition Precedent to Our liability under the '
  'Policy, the Insured Person or the Nominee, as the case may be,\n'
  'must notify Us/ Our TPA either at the call centre or in writing and shall '
  'undertake the following:\n'
  '\n'
  'In the case of Accidental Death Benefit/ PTD/ PPD/ Critical Illness (if '
  'applicable) -The Insured Person or the Nominee, as the case may\n'
  'be, shall notify Us either at the call centre or in writing, within 10 days '
  'from the date of occurrence of such Accident/diagnosis of a\n'
  'Critical Illness.\n',
  '\n'
  'Expenses related to any treatment necessitated due to participation as a '
  'professional in hazardous or adventure sports, including but\n'
  'not limited to, para-jumping, rock climbing, mountaineering, rafting, motor '
  'racing, horse racing or scuba diving, hand gliding, sky\n'
  'diving, deep-sea diving.\n'
  '\n'
  '10.Breach of law (Code-Excl10):\n'
  '\n'
  'Expenses for treatment directly arising from or consequent upon any Insured '
  'Person committing or attempting to commit a breach of\n'
  'law with criminal intent.\n'
  '\n'
  '11.Excluded Providers (Code - Excl11)\n'
  '\n'
  'Expenses incurred towards treatment in any hospital or by any Medical '
  'Practitioner or any other provider specifically excluded by the\n'
  'Insurer and disclosed on its website/notified to the policyholders are not '
  'admissible. However, in case of life-threatening situations or\n'
  'following an accident, expenses up to the stage of stabilization are '
  'payable but not the complete claim.\n'
  '\n'
  '12\\. Treatment for, Alcoholism, drug or substance abuse or any addictive '
  'condition and consequences thereof. (Code-Excl12)\n'
  '\n'
  '13\\. Treatments received in health hydros, nature cure clinics, spas or '
  'similar establishments or private beds registered as a nursing home\n'
  'attached to such establishments or where admission is arranged wholly or '
  'partly for domestic reasons. (Code-Excl13)\n'
  '\n'
  '14.Dietary supplements and substances that can be purchased without '
  'prescription, including but not limited to Vitamins, minerals and\n'
  'organic substances unless prescribed by a medical practitioner as part of '
  'hospitalisation claim or day care procedure. (Code-Excl14)\n'
  '\n'
  '15.Refractive Error (Code-Excl15):\n'
  '\n'
  'Expenses related to the treatment for correction of eyesight due to '
  'refractive error less than 7.5 dioptres.\n'
  '\n'
  '16.Unproven Treatments (Code- Excl16):\n'
  '\n'
  'Expenses related to any unproven treatment, services and supplies for or in '
  'connection with any treatment. Unproven treatments are\n'
  'treatments, procedures or supplies that lack significant medical '
  'documentation to support their effectiveness.\n'
  '\n'
  '17.Sterility and Infertility (Code-Excl17):\n'
  '\n'
  'Expenses related to Sterility and Infertility. This includes:\n'
  '\n'
  'i. Any type of contraception, sterilization\n'
  '\n'
  'ii. Assisted Reproduction services including artificial insemination and '
  'advanced reproductive technologies such as IVF, ZIFT, GIFT, ICSI\n'
  'iii. Gestational Surrogacy\n'
  '\n'
  'iv. Reversal of sterilization\n'
  '\n'
  '18.Maternity (Code-Excl18):\n'
  '\n'
  'i. Medical treatment expenses traceable to child birth (Including '
  'complicated deliveries and caesarean sections incurred during\n'
  'hospitalisation) except ectopic pregnancy;\n'
  '\n'
  'ii. Expenses towards miscarriage (unless due to an accident) and lawful '
  'medical termination of pregnancy during the policy period.\n'
  '\n'
  '\n'
  '### C.Specific Exclusions\n'
  '\n'
  '1\\. All expenses, caused by or arising from or attributable to foreign '
  'invasion, act of foreign enemies, hostilities, warlike operations\n'
  '(whether war be declared or not or while performing duties in the armed '
  'forces of any country), civil war, public defense, rebellion,\n'
  'revolution, insurrection, military or usurped power.\n'
  '\n'
  '2\\. All Illness/expenses caused by ionizing radiation or contamination by '
  'radioactivity from any nuclear fuel (explosive or hazardous form)\n'
  'or from any nuclear waste from the combustion of nuclear fuel nuclear, '
  'chemical or biological attack.\n'
  '\n'
  '3\\. a) Stem cell implantation/Surgery, harvesting, storage or any kind of '
  'Treatment using stem cells except as provided for in clause III.8\n'
  '(12) above;\n'
  '\n'
  'b) growth hormone therapy.\n'
  '\n'
  '4\\. External Congenital Anomaly or defects.\n'
  '\n'
  '5\\. Circumcision unless necessary for Treatment of an Illness or Injury '
  'not excluded hereunder or due to an Accident.\n'
  '\n'
  '6\\. Conditions for which treatment could have been done on an out-patient '
  'basis without any Hospitalisation.\n'
  '\n'
  '7\\. Any treatment or part of a treatment that is not of a reasonable '
  'charge, is not a Medically Necessary Treatment; drugs or treatments\n'
  'which are not supported by a prescription.\n'
  '\n'
  '8\\. Costs of donor screening or costs incurred in an organ transplant '
  'Surgery involving organs not harvested from a human body.\n'
  '\n'
  '9\\. Any form of Alternative Treatment:\n'
  'i. Hydrotherapy, Acupuncture, Reflexology, Chiropractic Treatment or any '
  'other form of indigenous system of medicine.\n'
  '\n'
  '10.Dental Treatment, dentures or Surgery of any kind unless necessitated '
  'due to an Accident and requiring minimum 24 hours\n'
  'Hospitalisation. Treatment related to gum disease or tooth disease or '
  'damage unless related to irreversible bone disease involving the\n'
  'jaw which cannot be treated in any other way.\n'
  '\n'
  '11.Routine eye examinations, cost of spectacles, multifocal lens, contact '
  'lenses.\n'
  '\n'
  '12.a) Cost of hearing aids; including optometric therapy;\n'
  '\n'
  '13\\. Vaccinations inoculations of any kind, except when required as part '
  'of hospitalization or a daycare procedure for treatment following\n'
  'an animal bite.\n'
  '\n'
  '14.Any Treatment and associated expenses for alopecia, baldness, wigs, or '
  'toupees and hair fall Treatment and products,\n'
  '\n'
  '15.Cost incurred for any health check-up or for the purpose of issuance of '
  'medical certificates and examinations required for employment\n'
  'or travel or any other such purpose.\n'
  '\n'
  '16.Any stay in Hospital without undertaking any Treatment or any other '
  'purpose other than for receiving eligible Treatment of a type that\n'
  'normally requires a stay in the Hospital.\n'
  '\n'
  '17.Artificial life maintenance including life support machine use, from the '
  'date of confirmation by the treating doctor that the patient is in\n'
  'a vegetative state.\n'
  '\n'
  '18.Certification / diagnosis / Treatment by a family member, or a person '
  'who stays with the Insured Person, save for the proven material\n'
  'costs which are eligible for reimbursement as per the applicable cover, or '
  'from persons not registered as Medical Practitioners under\n'
  'the respective Medical Councils, or from a Medical Practitioner who is '
  'practicing outside the discipline that he is licensed for.\n'
  '\n'
  '19.Prostheses, corrective devices and and/or Medical Appliances, which are '
  'not required intra-operatively for the Illness/ Injury for which\n'
  'the Insured Person was Hospitalised.\n'
  '\n'
  '20\\. Treatment received outside India.\n'
  '\n'
  '21.a) Instrument used in Treatment of Sleep Apnea Syndrome (C.P.A.P.); b) '
  'Oxygen Concentrator for Bronchial Asthmatic condition; c)\n'
  'Infusion pump or any other external devices used during or after '
  'Treatment.\n'
  '\n'
